content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												Let's get things straight: this game is statisfying for certain poeple so don't hate on it right away.Viscera Cleanup Detail (or VCD for short) is a game about cleaning murder scenes. You probally think that that is disgusting, but it's actually quite interessting. I personally discovered this game by a video of Nerd³. Since then I played this game for 28 hours already and I love it. It has funny bits and pieces and also some story in every map. For people who are new to this game should definitly ask someone to get them started (like me). The game does not have a tutorial and that's one of the things that makes this game a bit less likeable, but as always someone made a tutorial level on the steam workshop to get you started.The maps on this game go from 45 mnutes of playtime to 3 HOURS of playtime and the sizes go from small to huge. Most maps have around 1-2 hours of playtime wich is long you may think but once you play the game you won't even notice (I've done 5 hours straight without noticing.).A far as mechanics go there is not too much special. Only some tools and machines that appear in every level. Some tools are level specific. There are also secondary objectives that won't influence your score. The controls are quite easy, just WASD and mouse buttons (or xbox 360 controls). As far as multiplayer goes there are  few options:splitscreen co-op for wich you need to be on the pc and need two xbox 360 controllers. Then you have multiplayer server for up to 28 people (not recommended though). The servers are not paid or don't require any difficult set-up things to do but are a bit slow sometimes. For the multiplayer servers you can make them public or friends only wich comes in handy when you're trying to do a speedrun or so.For VCD I would give a 9/10. I hope you found this helpful and thanks for reading. Regards, Spider.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Viscera Cleanup Detail has been a surprising amount of fun to play... Set in the kind of world where the antics of the various action heroes aren't just glossed over you're the one who has to clean it up... all of it. The alien goo, the dead scientists and co workers. But even though you load into what has to be some of the most gruesome situations, there's something very satisfying about puttering around the crime scene just cleaning up the mess. From figuring out how to best move the body parts to deciding what section of the floor needs moping first, its the most fun I've had from a first person perspective for a long time. XD

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 22, 2016
												If you have time to kill, want to blow off stress, and/or loving the concept of cleanliness but hate the effort then this game is for youViscera Clean-up Detail is a first person janitorial game where you, the player, are assigned to the deep reaches of space and even as far north as Santa's own workshop to clean up the mess left behind after a number of circumstances (Included but not limited to: Alien Genocide, Homocidal santa, loose experiments, etc)What's great about this game is that there's a very deep sense of calm as you mop up puddles of blood and burn biohazard bins full of every chunk of meat and viscera that should never leave the human body. Playing with friends is even more fun because now you can clean up quickly, hang out with your friends, and screw them over by dumping out all of their trash and kicking over the buckets of dirty blood and water to make even more messes.If you ever need a way to kick back, relax, and feel accomplished at something then just play Viscera Clean up Detail, most maps will be done in 2 hours on average and they can always be replayed so the cleaning fun is limitless

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								W4C Rating: 9.5/10Have you ever played a survival horror game and said, "Boy, I feel sorry for the poor schmuck who has to clean THIS up!"? Well, here's your mop! GET TO IT!Viscera Cleanup Detail brings the harsh (semi)reality of the Janitorial Arts to life with this incredibly addictive game that will keep you mopping up blood and guts for hours!Is it repetitive? Yes, absolutely - just like it would be in real life! The monotony of bucket carrying and body incineration is what drives you to finish your task. Toward the end, it becomes an obsession to finish your job and clock out.If there was one thing I'd want to see in future, it would be an assessment upon completion: Either a written report, or a superior doing a survey of the area. Something to let you know if you're as thorough as you think you are (I know there's the handheld gauge, but it's not 100% right 100% of the time).Incredibly enjoyable game, I highly recommend it!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								Limb to bin, bin to fire. Mop to blood, mop to bucket, bucket to fire. Over and over again. 'Fun' is not something you will find in this game, but after bucket after bucket, you find yourself mesmerised and enthralled by the repetition of the experience. As you delve deeper into madness (and yes, you are mad for playing this game, mad or stupid) you will take up trophies and prizes, human head, alien heads, strange notes, seeds, spores and anything that looks remotely interesting you will end up stuffing in that blue box that keeps closing when you try and move it.At the end of a massacre, you will find yourself mourning over the dead bodies that you are shovelling into an inferno. You will recover notes and letters that could possibly belong to the corpse that you just threw into the fire. You cannot help him, he is lost, so you take his head and shove it into your blue box, maybe he will be remembered by sitting alongside all the other identical heads on your desk at the office, sitting right next to the head of the alien he slaughtered.Never has a game made me do the most boring thing in the world without any sort of reward. Bucket after bucket, everything into the fire. Hoping to whatever alien god there is, that you won't accidentally throw your only light source and break it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2016
												Before I purchased Viscera Cleanup Detail I had seen it multiple times on Steam thinking it was just another indie title set to fail. I was wrong. It's strangely relaxing to walk around inside of a massive evil complex and clean up the guts and gore. Who knew?The multiplayer is excellent even though it's got its bugs & quirks. Items sometimes go haywire due to some weird clipping issues but it doesnt make the game any worse. It makes it more unpredictable and fun since it creates another mess that you and your friends need to clean up. 


YouTube™ Video: Viscera Cleanup Detail with Matt & almost Frank 

			Views: 31		

			Cleaning the lab, learning how to play -- Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/reemrtv		

There's nothing like collecting bodyparts and incinerating buckets of blood with your friends. Apart from the cleaning up there's a lot of secrets, references and puzzles within the maps that make it more interesting. One map slowly makes you realize that you are within the robot factory where the terminator was made and that some of those robots malfunctioned and started slaughtering everybody.If you are looking for a relaxing game to play then this is a good choice. If you're looking for action and depth you should go elsewhere.

Most maps have around 1-2 hours of playtime wich is long you may think but once you play the game you won't even notice (I've done 5 hours straight without noticing.).A far as mechanics go there is not too much special. Only some tools and machines that appear in every level. Some tools are level specific. There are also secondary objectives that won't influence your score. The controls are quite easy, just WASD and mouse buttons (or xbox 360 controls). As far as multiplayer goes there are  few options:splitscreen co-op for wich you need to be on the pc and need two xbox 360 controllers. Then you have multiplayer server for up to 28 people (not recommended though). The servers are not paid or don't require any difficult set-up things to do but are a bit slow sometimes. For the multiplayer servers you can make them public or friends only wich comes in handy when you're trying to do a speedrun or so.For VCD I would give a 9/10. I hope you found this helpful and thanks for reading. Regards, Spider.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								W4C Rating: 9.5/10Have you ever played a survival horror game and said, "Boy, I feel sorry for the poor schmuck who has to clean THIS up!"? Well, here's your mop! GET TO IT!Viscera Cleanup Detail brings the harsh (semi)reality of the Janitorial Arts to life with this incredibly addictive game that will keep you mopping up blood and guts for hours!Is it repetitive? Yes, absolutely - just like it would be in real life! The monotony of bucket carrying and body incineration is what drives you to finish your task. Toward the end, it becomes an obsession to finish your job and clock out.If there was one thing I'd want to see in future, it would be an assessment upon completion: Either a written report, or a superior doing a survey of the area. Something to let you know if you're as thorough as you think you are (I know there's the handheld gauge, but it's not 100% right 100% of the time).Incredibly enjoyable game, I highly recommend it!

content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								Limb to bin, bin to fire. Mop to blood, mop to bucket, bucket to fire. Over and over again. 'Fun' is not something you will find in this game, but after bucket after bucket, you find yourself mesmerised and enthralled by the repetition of the experience. As you delve deeper into madness (and yes, you are mad for playing this game, mad or stupid) you will take up trophies and prizes, human head, alien heads, strange notes, seeds, spores and anything that looks remotely interesting you will end up stuffing in that blue box that keeps closing when you try and move it.At the end of a massacre, you will find yourself mourning over the dead bodies that you are shovelling into an inferno. You will recover notes and letters that could possibly belong to the corpse that you just threw into the fire. You cannot help him, he is lost, so you take his head and shove it into your blue box, maybe he will be remembered by sitting alongside all the other identical heads on your desk at the office, sitting right next to the head of the alien he slaughtered.Never has a game made me do the most boring thing in the world without any sort of reward. Bucket after bucket, everything into the fire. Hoping to whatever alien god there is, that you won't accidentally throw your only light source and break it.

Early Access Review
								This game is actually pretty relaxing. What might seem tedious, like pikcing up 50 machine gun shell casing and putting them into a rubbish bin, has a nice ambience. The quite to the game, it reminds me of the ambient element of The Stanley Parable, perhaps sans the overt element of mystery. There's something peaceful about methodically sorting away the aftermath of a chaotic incident.A lot more could be done with this game, and I hope early access sees it through to actual storylines or begining to end progression and more dynamic gameplay elements. I mean, stuff like the furnace and tesla gun are great, but I'd like more props. It would be great if there were more to the game as a whole, and also if it took itself seriously enough to build more atmosphere and make a story. So far, the humar is remenisenct to Cago Captain, which was fine for that game. But this doesn't go well with that level of camp.All in all, I haven't played much of it, but its a cool idea.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2016
												I love this game! It's great for just sitting down and relaxing. I've already played through the whole game once before (prior to achievements being added), and I can't wait to play it again.Clean in-game and avoid cleaning in real life! Who would have thought cleaning was so stress-relieving?Pros:Game gives you some background info for each levelCleaning is relaxing and even fun, especially on multiplayer/co-opI get my own office where I can store crap!Creepy previous janitor whom you can learn more aboutLOTS of levels which take a long time to complete (an hour or two for a thorough cleaning done by 2 people) mean you get your money's worthFlavor text in the form of notes in your office if you forget to do something, get employee of the month, or do a good jobLots of achievements to go for. They're kind of my thing.As much as I love this game, there are a coupleCons:Game can be glitchy, especially on multiplayer, ex.: items in bins teleporting across the room, trash/bodies jumping out of bins, body parts causing bins to "stutter" in placeIssues with joining. I once spent a solid 5 minutes restarting the game trying to join a friend on co-op because it wouldn't connect.Having to switch to Windows to play (I'm Linux master race)I can totally overlook the cons though. They are very minor issues and can be worked around.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												This game is a reminder of who the real heroes are in the event of an epic disaster: the cleanup crew. Not even the most fearless of action heroes is ever seen taking the time to clean up after themselves, especially after their work is done and they've recieved their commemorations and free hookers. It is the critical job of the cleanup crew to do what the action hero does not. This game takes no time in reminding you just how miserable and thankless that job truly is.There's no tutorial, so you figure out everything on your own at your own pace.Once you understand your job and equipment, you learn to prioritize what needs to be done to keep the area clean.You develop a system for eficiently removing the large array of blood, body parts, bullet casings, and other assorted trash from an area, all while maintaining cleanliness in previously cleaned areas.You WILL make mistakes and your equipment WILL malfunction, causing more of a mess, but you will learn to accept it and move on because its all part of the job.You will clean the area to the best of your ability and allow the previously bloodied, body-strewn, trash-filled area to once again shine with its original beauty.You will clock out and return to your office, confident that you did your best.What will this get you? A level up? An unlocked item? A large exciting trophy? Untold riches? Hookers and ice cream? At the very least, a celebratory beer round with your coworkers?No.You will return to your empty office and it will look just the same as any other day. Maybe if you did a good enough job you will be Employee of the Month, with a small picture framed on the wall. Maybe some newspaper clippings will commemorate (or condemn) the hard work that you did...but nothing more. No celebration. No beer round. No sexy ladies. Just you and your office.Your lonely, lonely office.10/10 most fun I've ever had being miserable

content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								We have been killing people and monsters and zombies and aliens and everything we had in our eyesight for the last 20 years.In space, under the sea, or wherever.Cut them in pieces or shoot them rounds and rounds of a shotgun or a pistol.And, finally, when the last alien or monster or zombie or human was dead, we saved the space station, or the world, or the galaxy, or even the universe.But we never thought in what happens after that. And that's Viscera Cleanup Detail.You're a Cleaner. You must clean the mess the hero left in his quest in the space station. Alone, or with friends, or with other people.Clean the blood, take the shells of the bullets and the body parts you will find everywhere. Finally, clean everything and burn all the needless things, to make the lab useful again.Lots of people ask everyday: "Is this game fun? Really?"Yes, it is. Why? Well, for the ones who played to make the mess, of course this is fun. I've played lots of games like this, so this is a simple (but not easy) game about that. It's another view about that type of games.You must have lots of patience, though. Because every time you trip in some thing, you will make a mess. A mess you must clean.Completely recomended.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												Some people enjoy white noise. They lay on the beach listening to the waves, they rest their eyes while sitting beside a window being pelted with rain, or even run humming electronics like fans just for the sound. Viscera Cleanup Detail is the videogame version of white noise. A calming oasis in the midst of noisy bother. There is something decidedly zen about cleansing a space station of all evidence of violence. You mop the blood, sweep the shells, burn the body parts, bin the trash, and restock the medkits. It scratches the OCD itch - you can have a place for everything and everything in its place. Besides that there's progression with your persistent janitor's office (as long as you don't get fired), hidden secret items and references to many games and films, a speed run mode, widely praised chaotic multiplayer, nice graphics and a small backstory about a mad custodian murderer. This game gives us a peek behind the curtain of the violent video game; the aftermath of encounters with aliens, robots, mutants (and surprisingly no zombies) has to be dealt with by someone, after all. There's a certain absurdist practicality to it all - because OF COURSE the evil corporation funding evil science would have an evil sanitation company with downtrodden working stiffs using hilariously dangerous and deadly equipment.Honestly, every violent game coming out ought to get a unique level just as Shadow Warrior did, perhaps with unique cleaning necessary. Clean up ripped and torn demonic guts in DOOM, incinerate dead Pyros in Team Fortress, that sort of thing. If this all sounds good to you, you should play Viscera Cleanup Detail!  Because if it bleeds you can kill it, and if it dies you can clean it.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												Viscera Cleanup Detail is nothing more than a cleaning simulator. Somehow though, it's fun and entertaining without getting boring. It brilliantly tackles the idea that there's someone out there in these fictional horror movies who eventually has to clean everything up. While it gives an uneasy horror vibe through its sounds and cold, gory sights, the contradiction of the mundane cleaning task at hand keeps the absurdity in the forefront. Although you won't have to worry about dying to monsters yourself (maybe) that doesn't mean you won't have to endure your own personal horror story. The first time you spill a dirty bucket of water in an area you've thoroughly cleaned, you'll experience a similar feeling of dread that the horror genre is known for. It'll make you keep saying "What the hell am I even doing?" weather it's your first day on the job or your 665th.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2016
												Warning: The following revivew contains brutal honesty. Please be advisedViscera Cleanup Detail is a game where you play as a Janitor after a aftermath has happened in different facility's.The main objective of this game is to simply clean. No fighting, no killing, no story, just clean. The game can get very boring and you can often get burnt out if you don't take often breaks. Here are the Pro's and Con's of this game.                                       Pros+Pro: The graphics are pretty neat even on the Unreal Engine+Pro: It a Includes level editor which means you can download workshop maps+Pro: Funny physics+Pro: A good game to waste time on if you're bored and rack up some hours+Pro: Good optimization+Pro: It has Trading Cards!                              Neutral= The boringness kicks in pretty fast= It can get tedious= The Physics can be annoying                                Con's- Could be a little bit more fun, and what I mean is that if you're not a cleaning person or a work person, you wont enjoy this- When you pick things up it blocks your field of view. This can be bad when you're trying to put things in buckets- Sometimes there are really big physic glitches- The tiny bits cause unnessacary blood- Co-op and Local Co-op are practically impossibleOverall: 6/10

content:
Posted: January 13
What kind of friends do you have? TL;DR Viscera Cleanup Detail is a game that has 2 sides. One side being a very relaxing experience full of peace no real threats, Then on the other had it’s a disastrous mess that will make you lose friends faster than monopoly. The maps have many secrets to find and collect which gives a little more incentive for exploring and will keep you playing a bit longer.Follow us here Steamship Discord: https://discord.gg/XbsKrtKSteamship Steam group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thesteamshipPros  extremely detailed mapsSecrets galoreGreat lighting system.Filled with entertaining events Cons Lack of storyextremely detailed mapsNothing to keep you committed---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- GameplayThis game will drive you crazy if you give it your full attention, you’ll start to notice how detailed the maps are and all the hidden places full of blood and cadavers. It’s a very relaxing game because of the lack of threats and a timer, just take your time and make these spaceships sparkle. Having friends playing with you can be hilarious to some and a bane to others as it is so easy to create a mess. Characters This game has a lack of any story and few characters there is a secret and very interesting character in the game that leaves notes throughout the maps. There are also leftover notes and logs about the incidents that happened to make the levels such a mess which adds a feeling of a living world.  Art/Graphics Its not the most beautiful game , it uses simple designs and colors, bit the level of detail in the level to clean is so good and the lighting system is great making you use many sources of light to find everythingBonus NotesThis Is what Id describe as the perfect podcast game and its so satisfying to get a perfect score The games DLCs are just things that max the game more silly and would agree getting them if they are in a bundle. Just cause 2 is one of the best open world games and will give hours of entertainment.If you like this join us here to get the latest Reviews:Steamship Discord: https://discord.gg/XbsKrtKSteamship Steam group : http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thesteamshipWhat would you like to see for our next review ? Ask in the comment section!

content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								Vicera Cleanup detail is easily one of the most mind numbingly repettative games ive ever plays, but it is also one of the most enjoyable, great looking, and different games I have ever played. To start off like all reviews I want to remind everyone this is still considered to be an early access game, so there is still more to be added as well as more to be changed, so anything I say about the game is subject to change.Viscera cleanup is not exactly what most people likely would consider playing at first glance, however if you start to look deeper and actually give it a try, you will find yourself obsesevly cleaning every drop of blood off every map for hours at a time just because it feels that rewarding after doing so much work and getting praised for it. The game gets even better when you play with friends and fool around on the maps, finding all the sercret areas, and cleaning them up as well, or even making a mess of the place after one of your friends is done cleaning it up just to be annoying :P.Not only is the gameplay surprisingly addictive and fun, but the visuals are fantastic, not to say it has the most amazing effects out there, were not talking about explosions and lazers or anything, but just the sheer ammount of junk, and blood and bullet holes around the map make it really feel like there was a huge fight there not to long ago. I will say they tend to repaste textures pretty often which can make some walls and other features pretty dull to look at, but in the end it tends to help when looking for that one stray bullet hole you just cant seem to find.Now like all games there are still flaws, and despite it being in beta I still feel it necessary to point them out. Only just recently was there a server browser added, and on top of this due to the long time without it, it is unfortunalty grossly under used. There are alot of features still missing in the game from what I have been reading, and still alot of bugs to work through like a spot of blood being cleaned up but it not being counted as clean. stray bullets clipping through walls, and of course physics engine issues with various objects and the players interactions with them.Those small issues tend to go overlooked however with just how much fun there is to have in the game, in fact a body part falling from the bottom of trash can tends to end up being funny and enjoyable more often then annoying and tedious.So if you like the tediousness of cleaning up after someone else, and want to just have a fun time killer to hop on once and a wile, I highly recommend Viscera Cleanup, you may not be running around with guns, but a mop is so much more rewarding and immersive.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								Viscera Cleanup Detail is a first game that makes you clean the area instead of making it dirty. Despite the welcoming's screen message about venomous bugs, i haven't seen much. Playing this game requires some time - average time spent on completing map is always above 1 hour. Player becomes janitor, working on space space stations after alien accident. This event lest the area in terrible condition, and your duty is to clean it up. No matter how boring it sounds to be - well, life simulator seemed to be boring, too, but the sims sell pretty well. It's simple - burn bodies and other junk, sweep blood from floor and walls, stack barrels and crates in stacking areas, remove bullet holes... pretty simple, but I find it a great way to fight stress. Plus, achievements are relatively easy.

Anyway, back to cleaning up♥♥♥♥♥♥Love,Arthalamew, Chief Executive Director of Janitorial Processes and Professional "Crime Scene" Cleaner

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
												Ever wondered who cleaning up the mess in games like Serious Sam, Shadow Warrior or DOOM after you eliminated every living organism on the map? This game is the answer!Positive pointsGraphics- Pretty sweet and the graphic style fit perfectly to this game.- Sometimes the lights are a bit too extremeGameplay- Simple mechanics but pretty much fun. I dont really know why I enjoy cleaning a virtual room while I hate cleaning in real life o_o- The "Cleaning machines can spit out limbs and♥♥♥♥♥♥quot; mechanic is something I really hate... just no!Maps- I like the variation of the maps. Different themes with many easter eggs and around 20 maps on count is not bad.Neutral pointsMultiplayer- Well multiplayer seems to be pretty dead. Playing with random people is a rare phenomenon. If I imagine how MP would be played by the players I can just think about a LOT of trolls ♥♥♥♥ing things up all the time so..- This game can be pretty much fun on LAN parties or if you play with friends especially if you are drunk =DNegative pointsBugs- Over the time there were many bug fixes but still there is a problem with objects glitching around. Objects can glitch under the map so you can complete the map, objects glitches through your boxes or the incinerator. Can be very frustrating cause all your work was useless in this case.- Cleaning machine sometimes just stop working so you can restart the map.Miscellaneous- On some maps there is dirt/blood on the blanket of the map so you have to build a tower with your boxes which is a very, VERY frustrating task.- My progress and my settings was reseted so many times..ConclusionFunny game which you can play from time to time. Fun factor increasing when you play it with friends. One of the few games which started as Early Access game on steam and made it to a complete game. The game is time intensive and can frustrated you sometimes but overall it is much more fun than cleaning your home in real life!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Viscera Cleanup Detail puts you in the shoes of a janitor cleaning up after what seems like a B-Grade thriller or horror movie. There are body pieces to take care of, blood to mop up, and miscellaneous items to incinerate. The game makes wonderful atmosphere with it's large environments and while there are no threats that can kill you, while cleaning alone, I find myself still paranoid as hell that something is going to pop up, scream at me and then gleefully cackle as they run off map. Cleaning is no easy chore, however. There are countless hidden blood spots and body pieces hidden in corners and that are much too easily missed when glancing over. The only gripe I have is that it doesn't exactly make a server that isn't hosted locally by whomever the local host ends up being. Hopefully, it'll be added in at a later date but until then, playing with friends from far places definitely makes things difficult. It's a wonderful game. It kills time, probably replayable if you haven't gotten every map spotless and spit shined to perfection. (Draxentus has a Youtube series on this showing off most maps) - Shameless self promotion.(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G1AROtGBphQ&list=PLLdAQqj8UMZMkEN5AZXNluOx2b0QoC_Cc&index=2)

Early Access Review
								This game is fun in the same sense that staring into the end of a laser pointer is fun.In all seriousness though, if you enjoyed titles like Surgeon Simulator or Kerbal Space Program, you may find yourself cleaning every nook and cranny questioning yourself the whole time for doing it. Is it cutting edge gameplay the likes of which has never been seen before? Not really a fair question to ask here, but it is original.After spending tedious hours (days? weeks? time is irrelevant in this game) cleaning my first section of a space station littered with human corpses and alien remains, I found myself compelled to finish. It's something to hold your attention and draw your mind away from conventional gaming, and it does this quite well.I'm definitely excited to see where future development takes this game.

												This game is stupidly good. Being a janitor has no right to be this fun, yet there is a real sense of satisfaction in turning an absolute mess into a shining, flawless space station/lab/mine/whatever. Great graphics, great gameplay - though I will say, online play is a little laggy, with 40 ping making you teleport a fair bit and 80 being practically unplayable. Still, it's stupidly fun.

												Clean up after FPS protagonists and awful, horrifying accidents. Best to clean with friends or you will tear out your hair (have you any to rip out).Just kidding, it's best to just screw around and play with friends by throwing entrails and limbs at one another, pretending to make severed heads talk, throwing your friends out airlocks and sabatoging the scissor lift to watch your friend, who simply wants to clean blood from the ceiling, fall to their death. Crack jokes over voice chat like throwing an arm at your friend and saying "Need a hand?" or dropping the scissor lift on your friend and saying "I'm sorry, I thought you needed a lift." Handing your friend a leg and saying "It's a foot long!" Splatter your friend with bloody mops are start a fire on the job with a laser meant to sauter bullet holes. Just have fun with it! WITH FRIENDS!+ Great graphics+ Fun to play with physics+ Easy controls+ Extremely fun with friends+ Discover new things in your office+ Fun to make a mess+ Even dying is funny+ Hilarious to clean one of your previous character model's corpses+ Truly feels like you're funded by a cheap cleaning company+ Sniffer is an extremely useful tool+ Flinging feces around your friend's office+ Great music- Physics can glitch out and cause a bigger mess or prevent a 100% cleanliness rating- The stress you feel when using a scissor lift- The frustration when you miss something small and don't get that 100% rating- The annoying radio

Early Access Review
								Aliens have invaded Earth and infect all with a disease. They're fought off, and the disease takes it's toll. As humanity gets weaker, they send one hero to find an antidote. You can serve your alien overlords well and maybe they won't eat you when they take over the Earth.Buy today!

content:
Posted: May 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is early access, so I can't yet make any "official" comment about it, but I can tell you that this is actually a really fun game. At least to me, it can be addicting. Most people may not think so because all you do here is clean. And for that, you might as well clean in real life and get paid for it. While they have good points on this, remember that people thought the same thing about The Sims, a game where you simulate real life. And that franchise has become really popular. So maybe this game will have the same effect.If nothing else, it is a way to pass the time. And cleaning doesn't have to be the only thing you can do. Invite your friends over and make a big mess. Play viscera golf with your mop. Create art. Play viscera pong with buckets. And for $8, is not that bad.The game may not stay $8 after it's full release. As the developers stated. So if you're really interested, download this while it's still on sale. And as a bonus, you will also get Santa's Rampage and Shadow Warrior maps for free! So decide now while these offers still last.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Tedious and deeply massocistic, Viscera Cleanup detail is not a game for everyone. As a reminder to those who believe in a brighter future for all, this game is a solem reminder that even in the 22nd century, we're still going to need janitors. After all, who's left to clean up the messes left behind by the steroid addled space soldiers but the poor janitor? Your tools for the job are deeply inadequate, given that you've got a mop, a barely function grime scanner, and your own two hands. Assisting you are a few pieces of recklessly malfunctioning equipment that will ocassionally dispense bits of of your fellow humans rather than the useful buckets and biohazard bins required to cart their remains. Add to the that the problem of your own footprints tracking blood and bile, and the game becomes an exercise in playing catch up as your previously sparkling rooms once again become horror shows.Viscera Cleanup Detail is the sort of game that gives you that sort of smug, self punshing joy that you get from completing a task that is both meaningless, yet somehow compelling. Much like Tetris, your errors pile up and your acomplishments disappear. In addition to recieving absolutely no reward for a job well done, any stray casing, bullet hole, or partially dismembered corpse leaves you with a snarky note in your office about how how badly you've failed. All that said, you may better spend your time doing something else. In the two plus hours it takes you to complete the first level, you could clean your entire house and get the satisfaction of a job well done, as well as the fact that you won't be deeply embarrased by unexpected guests. But if you are a masochist, and you enjoy tedious, unrewarding gameplay for the sake of completion, than this is the game for you.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								Viscera Cleanup Detail is very much a "niche" game. It's something most people won't like or understand, but for those who do like it, it's an interesting take on blood and gore in video games. There's something very Zen-like about listening to music/TV/podcasts while mopping up blood and carting away limbs to the furnace.The visuals and lighting effects are well-used, even if it is difficult to spot blood at certain times. It definitely *looks* like a game in Early Access, but for a game in Early Access, I've certainly seen worse. Levels are small and easy to navigate, and the tools at your disposal are simple and easy-to-master. The physics are screwy as hell, though. Sometimes limbs like to melt through the bins and make your floor dirty again. Sometimes you'll bump into something and it'll freak out.If there's anything about this game I can hate, considering its status as Early Access, it hast to be the nonexistent depth perception. This is a problem in all games, but with a game like Viscera Cleanup Detail, where you have to be more careful with your movements, placing items into a bin or trying to grab an object from a certain distance away are difficult at best. This could be solved with better dynamic shadows, but it would come at the expense of graphical performance, and frankly, Unreal Engine 3 isn't as powerful as you might think.Regardless, I'm excited for this game, and despite its status as a work in progress, it already shows some healthy meat on its bones.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								I don't know where to start, with this.  A friend got this as a joke, streamed it, we had a good laugh, then he sent me a copy.  It's turned into something similar to Train Simulator for us, but I still managed to get almost 5 hours in this.  You're a space janitor in a space location cleaning up gibs, both human and alien, with it being implied that the "Heroes" have already been through and killed everything that needed killing, as evidenced by the spent shells and casings everywhere.  The physics are wonky, and every time you knock over your bucket full of blood, a piece of your soul will shrivel up and die.  Still, it's strangely entertaining, especially for those of us with a compulsive need to complete things.  I think everyone should buy this when it's on sale and try to complete just one level.  It's pretty cute.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Station is infested with all kinds of vermin. There is no hope for all who are on the station. What terrible fate awaits? Grab your tools, gear and get ready. Because the hero just fixed the problem and guess who is on clean-up duty?Anyways, you (and possible your friends) are janitors tasked to clean up the mess, and a mess there is. Parts from people and speciments litter every corner, blood cover floor wall and celling, hazardous materials, crates and whatever food the hero ate and discarded, along with bullet casings are here. Get a Disposable bin fill it with materials, get a bucket and mop the floor and burn EVERYTHING that isnt nailed down.The game is surprisingly fun and sometimes a little difficult, with the nasty placement of things and the insane amount of footprints you make. Teamwork can be used to maximize efficincy, to hunt down what you miss and to reach difficult spot. The only problem is the lack of content and a scoring system to judge how well you did, but since it's early access these thing s will most likely be fixed. Difinitely recommended!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Tedious and deeply massocistic, Viscera Cleanup detail is not a game for everyone. As a reminder to those who believe in a brighter future for all, this game is a solem reminder that even in the 22nd century, we're still going to need janitors. After all, who's left to clean up the messes left behind by the steroid addled space soldiers but the poor janitor? Your tools for the job are deeply inadequate, given that you've got a mop, a barely function grime scanner, and your own two hands. Assisting you are a few pieces of recklessly malfunctioning equipment that will ocassionally dispense bits of of your fellow humans rather than the useful buckets and biohazard bins required to cart their remains. Add to the that the problem of your own footprints tracking blood and bile, and the game becomes an exercise in playing catch up as your previously sparkling rooms once again become horror shows.Viscera Cleanup Detail is the sort of game that gives you that sort of smug, self punshing joy that you get from completing a task that is both meaningless, yet somehow compelling. Much like Tetris, your errors pile up and your acomplishments disappear. In addition to recieving absolutely no reward for a job well done, any stray casing, bullet hole, or partially dismembered corpse leaves you with a snarky note in your office about how how badly you've failed. All that said, you may better spend your time doing something else. In the two plus hours it takes you to complete the first level, you could clean your entire house and get the satisfaction of a job well done, as well as the fact that you won't be deeply embarrased by unexpected guests. But if you are a masochist, and you enjoy tedious, unrewarding gameplay for the sake of completion, than this is the game for you.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								Viscera Cleanup Detail is very much a "niche" game. It's something most people won't like or understand, but for those who do like it, it's an interesting take on blood and gore in video games. There's something very Zen-like about listening to music/TV/podcasts while mopping up blood and carting away limbs to the furnace.The visuals and lighting effects are well-used, even if it is difficult to spot blood at certain times. It definitely *looks* like a game in Early Access, but for a game in Early Access, I've certainly seen worse. Levels are small and easy to navigate, and the tools at your disposal are simple and easy-to-master. The physics are screwy as hell, though. Sometimes limbs like to melt through the bins and make your floor dirty again. Sometimes you'll bump into something and it'll freak out.If there's anything about this game I can hate, considering its status as Early Access, it hast to be the nonexistent depth perception. This is a problem in all games, but with a game like Viscera Cleanup Detail, where you have to be more careful with your movements, placing items into a bin or trying to grab an object from a certain distance away are difficult at best. This could be solved with better dynamic shadows, but it would come at the expense of graphical performance, and frankly, Unreal Engine 3 isn't as powerful as you might think.Regardless, I'm excited for this game, and despite its status as a work in progress, it already shows some healthy meat on its bones.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								Imagine if after every sci-fi shooter out there, a janitor had to come in and clean up after the action hero's mess. Well, someone made that game, and that game is Viscera Cleanup Detail.No weapons. No Enemies. Just you, a mop, a "sniffer", buckets, waste-bins, a furnace, and a♥♥♥♥♥♥load of blood and guts to clean up.Keep in mind that this isn't as easy as it may sound, there's  a suprising amount of challenge in this game. If janitor simulators were striving for realism, then this game would be the Arma 2 of the genre. You have to get buckets to clean your mop, then replace buckets, you can knock buckets over which means more♥♥♥♥♥♥for you to clean up; you get the idea. This game is mostly a test of your patience, and just your overall common sense.In all honesty, though, this game is actually pretty fun. Especially if you have some friends to play it with. (Yes, there's a co-op feature, and if your friends are strict Call of Duty or Left 4 Dead types, chances are they're not going to want to play this...weirdoes.)It's only 8 bucks as I write this review, so why not get it? Play it, and next time, when you're blasting aliens in a giant space ship, think about the guy who has to come in and clean it up....you jerk.5 Minimum-Wage McLovin's out of 5

content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
Note: I initially reviewed this game in September of 2015 as an early access review, however, the review wasn't on par with my recent work, so decided to rewrite it.Remember all those games such as Dead Space where you're on a ship killing aliens?  VCD is the aftermath of that.  To someone who has never seen this game before, space janitor sounds so unappealing.  I mean, really, space janitor?  Janitorial game?  How can this be fun?  Somehow, VCD makes being a janitor the funnest thing in the world!  You're not just cleaning paper, dirty shoe prints, garbage, etc.  You're cleaning blood, decapitated bodies, bullet holes, the whole 9 yards when it comes to the aftermath of a space battle.  One of my favorite things about VCD is that it's gruesome.  You will find decapitated limbs, intestines, and organs that were, at one point, safely inside their owner.   Now, I'm sure you're thinking, 'there's a catch, right? It can't be purely a janitor simulator.' No catch, it's 100% janitor simulator. There are no bad guys, no shooting, nothing - just cleaning.  There are eery amibent noises meant to make you weary, but there's really no danger.If you're someone who is OCD, or someone who HAS to finish what they started, you will be spending hours in VCD.  Between walking in blood and then leaving a trail, to accidentally knocking over your blood-filled water bucket, to even flinging body parts around and getting blood everywhere - there is a lot to clean up.  It also depends on the map.  Some maps are smaller, thus, quicker and easier.  However, some of the other vanilla maps are larger, meaning you'll be spending a little bit more time on it.  One of the best things about this game is that there is Steam workshop.  There are quite a few community made maps, and most of them are just of amazing quality.  Workshop can always greatly help a game out, and it certainly has in this case.   I'm still waiting and hoping for the day of a Star Destroyer cleanup. :POne really nice thing is that there's multiplayer!  If you're looking for a quiet, peaceful game that lets you just talk with your friends, this is it.  I really have to commend the developers on VCD.  No one would've ever thought a janitor game would be fun, but they have proved that wrong.  Sure, depending on the person, a janitor simulator will be boring no matter what, but the guys at VCD really did their best to make a janiorial game entertaining, and they succeeded.  One tiny complaint I have is the music.  The developers were nice enough to include music via some type of tool (I have no clue what it is), but that music is just...bleh.  I kinda wish there was better music we could clean to.  I guess that's why we have things like Spotify.Positives: Quiet, peaceful game Shows you the aftermath of what we usually cause. Gruesome/Gorey No threats. Workshop Trading cards Multiplayer Controller support AchievementsNegatives: Could just be me, but I've noticed the frames aren't the best in this game. Music isn't the best.For more recommendations and reviews on our favourite up and coming quality games follow Lot's O Giveaway's, and check out our Curations.

content:
Posted: September 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								I can’t help but feel that a large portion of the gaming society don’t understand the true meaning of repetition. And what I mean by that is they don’t understand repetition. And what I mean by that is… well, you get the joke already. For those of you, dear egocentric viewers, who include yourself in this bewildered ratio the best place to learn is at your computer looking up the definition online. Or you could play Viscera Cleanup Detail which bases itself around the mundane and repetitive. And yet is somewhat intriguing in its attempt  to be the most boring game ever. You are a cleaner and your job is to clean until the level is clean and you can say that your cleaning has left the space you are asked to clean is clean, if you know what I clean. Bad puns aside, cleaning is the literal object of the game. It’s in the title if you were smart enough to put 2 and clean together. Alright, I’ll stop saying clean.The enjoyment in this piece of technological culture is to relax, put on a podcast and zone out while your brain cells rot and your inner neat freak is unleashed, which describes exactly what I did. To say this is a completionist game is an understatement when you consider that you’re given a tool that detects even the slightest smudge of blood and your life is threatened should you not do a good enough job. A prospect I know Groundskeeper Willie would be dying to attain. At the time of this review the game is still in alpha, but it already presents to you the realization of what effect your sci-fi shoot-em-up adventures really have on the lower class. I told you that you were egocentric. And I hope you’ve all noticed that I made this entire paragraph without using the word clean. Oh wait, damn it.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
												10/10 definitely would recommend.This game managed to carve out a niche into the FPS market. By making the player cleaning after the typical shootout, it creates a new genre. Just like Minecraft did, a few years ago. However, this game did not have the hype Mincraft enjoyed, and therefore hasn't spanwed any copycats... yet.Trust me, just like after a stressful day you may enjoy killing 2000 enemies in an FPS like Doom, on a boring, chilly and cloudy sunday, you'll enjoy playing some tunes while you remove viscera and litter and mop the blood off floor and walls. Even better, you can play it multiplayer and have a laugh with friends. The characters move in quite a cartoonish way, which adds up to the comic effect. Grab some dynamite and ignite it near a fellow co-worker: enjoy watching him blow up.The achievements require a few hours of work but are easily obtainable.The levels are magnificent. Each one has a unique atmosphere.The sounds are few due to the nature of the game, but are more than adequate. Maybe the sound of all the stuff cluttered into a disposal bin is a bit ridiculous, but that is nothing serious.The graphics are amazing. If you have a good computer, it'll look astonishing.The price is more than fair. The glitches are few, minor. Devs are constantly working on fixing as much as they can. Don't believe me? Check their facebook page.The only thing I'd criticise is the lack of explanation on how to use your tools and stacking areas. But the wiki is very detailed. And I'm sure this lack of info will be addressed soon enough.Overall 10/10. One of the very few games I definitely recommend.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
												This game is fantastic for multiplayer. It was so fun figuring out how to clean, trying to work together without tripping over each other, and mopping up the guts and grime -- with teamwork! The physics are a bit crazy: dismembered limbs with minds of their own, full boxes of guts randomly exploding, and parts popping out of boxes as they're carried. But that just adds to the entertainment. If you've ever wondered what happens after you clear a level in your favorite FPS, it's probably something like this. The complaints and praise after each job add to the realism (and hilarity), and the various clues about what happened in each level help the immersion and allow you to imagine what exciting things happened recently in the room you're tasked with cleaning.

content:
Posted: May 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is early access, so I can't yet make any "official" comment about it, but I can tell you that this is actually a really fun game. At least to me, it can be addicting. Most people may not think so because all you do here is clean. And for that, you might as well clean in real life and get paid for it. While they have good points on this, remember that people thought the same thing about The Sims, a game where you simulate real life. And that franchise has become really popular. So maybe this game will have the same effect.If nothing else, it is a way to pass the time. And cleaning doesn't have to be the only thing you can do. Invite your friends over and make a big mess. Play viscera golf with your mop. Create art. Play viscera pong with buckets. And for $8, is not that bad.The game may not stay $8 after it's full release. As the developers stated. So if you're really interested, download this while it's still on sale. And as a bonus, you will also get Santa's Rampage and Shadow Warrior maps for free! So decide now while these offers still last.

content:

Early Access Review
								This game isn't for everyone.I'm starting that way simply because I feel as though not many people would be into this kind of game.  I've personally always enjoyed games that are slow-paced, but the longer you go on you can look back and say "Yeah, I did that." There's nothing more satisfying than walking into a room that makes you say "Jesus!" out loud, but then later making that room spotless.  It's a lot of effort, but I think it's worth the payoff.  If you like slow-paced satisfying games, this is for you.

												>accidently drops a molotov by janitors chest filled of tnt to the ceiling in santas rampage>north pole gone in a mushroom cloudBut seriously this game is perfect. You can either work or make a bigger mess if you like. The community isn't toxic at all either which is brilliant. You get a office where you can store objects you find from maps that you work in and dont get fired in that you can bring to other maps. This game is filled with referenced objects like the crowbar and gordons glasses from HL, the facehugger from Alien, and the shotgun from Doom, that you can also keep as a collection in your office. There's not that many levels but still fun to play over a couple of times. Extremely fun to play with friends when they dont ♥♥♥♥ everything up, something like making a bigger mess when your cleaning or, lobbing some tntnades at you also making a bigger mess. I really love this game and would love to give more.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												Is this a game for everyone? No not really. But is it a good game? Indeed it is ^^/I haven't tried the multiplayer part, so I can't review that part of the game, sorry!/I will come with a statement that most games is in some kind of way and in a different degree quite repetitive, nontheless it can still be fun especially this one. Yes this is a simulator game, yes being a janitor is only about cleaning(and making a mess by accident or on purpose! XD), but why can this game still be fun? Well from my point of view being one who likes bloody shooting games and such, then this game is one big ironic joke. I have never had one single thought in my life what a mess I did in fact make when I was playing those bloody shooting games killing monsters or aliens, so this game is indeed karma XD in a good way.Do I think that this game is perfect? No, because the negative reviews are right, this game becomes repetitive which is why I would recommend this game for anyone who does not need to complete a game as quick as possible. Because this game for me is a way of relaxing(yeah I know, Ironic maybe even psychopatic XD) and cleaning a map here and there when you feel like it and not in one run. I enjoy the underlined humour in this beautiful game, I like to try to think about strategies to be as afficient as possible and then else just play and let my thoughts wander. :) Uses it as a break^^lets take the negative things first, the cons.- This game is not for everyone, if you only like fastpaced or a game with lot of "changes" then this game isn't for you because it becomes repetitive especially if you keep playing it for many hours at once.(which is not recommended)- The first map which probably most people will pick isn't the easiest one :)- A better "info"/manuel for what should be cleaned and done and about which things gives you points or not, I have heard something from somebody that if you stack barrels and crates and such and especially if they are in the same colour, then you will get extra points, but I cannot find a good manual for this.- Sometimes the "Slosh-O-Matic" can be really really annoying if it still gives you bloody body parts for the fifth time in the row.Then the positive things :) the sunshines.- A really original game which really is one big joke against players who has played games with similary scenaries as the ones you have to clean on in this game :) (Now I understand why in many shooting games that there can be accuracy rate and you get less points for less accuracy, because cleaning bullets holes are a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥♥ XD- Beautiful game, nothing to complain about the grafic.- Even though there isn't a big storyline for this game, then I really love and adore that they have put little details, bits of infomation and so on about what have happend and about your company and world in the maps. So you get to wonder and you get to explore :)- Lovely variarity of maps- I really really love the idea of janitors box, that you can take whatever you find in on the maps to your office! (feeling psychopathic when you are collecting heads)- (if you are a person who likes to do repetitive "work"/What ever to let you thoughts wander(meditation like) then this game is for you.)- So many details are within the game which gives the game a real charm- it is a easy game to quickly log out and come back to it later, so good for small breaks!(5-10 minutes)So overall I do really like this game, yes It is not one of those games where I would be able to use the whole day to play it, but for me it works really good, it is fun, beautiful and good as a break and mind-wander :)

												So when I first played this game I was having fun then had a issue in game with the storage boxes and had to delete my save files completely to reset them. After doing so and working out what not to do I have to take back a lot of the negativity I may of pushed across at first impression but to be honest this really is a good game that will keep you entertained for hours.The game plays on your own OCD, some have it worse than others but none the less the game will get you thinking in that mind set of getting things perfect spick and span mickey mouse.I dig games like this because they are original, no other games like it. I have not actually gotten around to trying it out but I have heard that the multiplayer for this game is no good as well, has a terrible server or something and people constantly get dropped from the server before they can complete a level which is dissappointing because this game would be hilarious to play multiplayer, running into each other and the likes so it is ashame if what I am hearing is correct.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2016
												10/10 definitely would recommend.This game managed to carve out a niche into the FPS market. By making the player cleaning after the typical shootout, it creates a new genre. Just like Minecraft did, a few years ago. However, this game did not have the hype Mincraft enjoyed, and therefore hasn't spanwed any copycats... yet.Trust me, just like after a stressful day you may enjoy killing 2000 enemies in an FPS like Doom, on a boring, chilly and cloudy sunday, you'll enjoy playing some tunes while you remove viscera and litter and mop the blood off floor and walls. Even better, you can play it multiplayer and have a laugh with friends. The characters move in quite a cartoonish way, which adds up to the comic effect. Grab some dynamite and ignite it near a fellow co-worker: enjoy watching him blow up.The achievements require a few hours of work but are easily obtainable.The levels are magnificent. Each one has a unique atmosphere.The sounds are few due to the nature of the game, but are more than adequate. Maybe the sound of all the stuff cluttered into a disposal bin is a bit ridiculous, but that is nothing serious.The graphics are amazing. If you have a good computer, it'll look astonishing.The price is more than fair. The glitches are few, minor. Devs are constantly working on fixing as much as they can. Don't believe me? Check their facebook page.The only thing I'd criticise is the lack of explanation on how to use your tools and stacking areas. But the wiki is very detailed. And I'm sure this lack of info will be addressed soon enough.Overall 10/10. One of the very few games I definitely recommend.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												Viscera Cleanup Detail is a first person "simulator" game about being space janitor. In space. Sure think it's a joke simulator, but gameplay itself is not broken on purpose unlike other such games. It was developed by RuneStorm and finally released out of Steam's Early Access in 2015 after entering it in 2014. And yep, coop multiplayer is primary focus. But can solo.It actually had two stand-alone spinoff before release, which included only a single level: Shadow Warrior tie-in and Santa's Rampage. And they are going to include them both into base VCD game for free. Actually, they already did it with Santa's Rampage, Shadow Warrior one is coming soon. Which also means that this review will become outdated soon, uh oh.It also still gets a support post-launch. It's probably not going to stay forever, not every game is Minecraft. But hey, new map!Technically, it does have a bunch of physics bugs. Most often you are going to be frustrated that "crisp" chips packets clipped at the bottom of the bin once again. Physics items also sometimes get stuck in geometry. The best way to handle it is to grab them, then hold the grab button (it will let you to rotate it) and swing your mouse around like crazy until it glitches out. Game may also not always be fair, hiding barely visible stain behind no-collision geometry, for example.Multiplayer community is kinda dead but not really. It's just that people usually prefer playing with people they know, since in this game you can mess up progress a lot. Can ask or find coop request in the forums. But if you just want to play with strangers and public, then the only thing you can expect to see in server browser is a bunch of empty password locked servers. Oh well.Your job in this game is to clean up the level from all the trash, guts and blood which happens to be there after some disaster of alien origin. It often references famous horror movies so it's fun if you get the reference. You spawn in the level and it's your job to burn all gibs and wash up all blood and burn up bullet holes and just make it look clean for your own amusement. The core gameplay can get repetetive, but it has this relaxive feel to it, especially if you don't turn on radio. It's also fun for those who love to do stuff fully and watch the progress of level getting cleaner. That, and things can sometimes go wrong, especially if you are playing with good friends. Somebody may knock the bucket of bloody water, for example. In multiplayer the fun comes from party aspect. Maybe more fun than doing it all solo.Oh, and you also have to spend time to use radar device to find out what you missed, which may also happen to be nastily hidden if you aim for 100%. Actually, the maximum completionists also can do paperworks, in which you have to report on what you think happened. Then bring USB sticks of dead people and choose what you think happened to them. And fill in boring stuff like number of shells found. It's pretty great idea, to combine being detective and janitor, but sadly it's more mundane and I just don't want to count all the shells.But it could use more variation between levels. Well, there is some, but it's not enough. This game just doesn't fit to play fully in solo.Which is why I like how the game is structured. It pretty much says you that you aren't supposed to beat it fully or play it all in solo. There is no linear campaign at all and there is no real requirements or real progress. You just pick mode, pick the map. Well, you do get achievement for beating them. But eh. You can even clock out from the level anytime, there is no real concequence to doing awful job. Well, I still would have liked story mode, but only if gameplay was less repetetive. At least this way it doesn't push me "beat whole game to be the men".And to be honest, I didn't. I only have done half of levels in solo, only big levels are left. And I want to tackle them only with friends now.It also has the office into which the game sends you after clocking out. It's a very small level, your little basement-like space. The point is that only at this point do you get a feedback on your job. You have screen which shows completion state, it puts paper around the room of hiralious accidents if you forgot to clean up something. It also is just your little home filled with useless stuff and you can bring up anything you want from the levels.And there isn't much else to it. It's a nice jokeish simulator. It's a relaxish experience to play solo and it has a great party effect when playing with friends.

content:
Posted: March 9
												It's a game about cleaning things up, like blood and viscera (hence the name). I like this game because as I clean a room, it kind of satisfies me. Like washing your car or something; you get to see the car become more clean as you go. But, the 'satisfying' effect wears off when I have been looking for the last blood stain or bullet casing for the past 20 minutes. In this dark map, I missed several blood stains on the ceiling and one casing. Viscera Cleanup Detail is not for everyone- some people may find this game half-baked. Your job is to mop the floor, throw stuff into a furnace, remove bullet holes with a laser thingy, and I think there are some enemies here or there on some levels. The game might become boring after a handful of hours because the gameplay can be repetitive. Despite this, VCD manages to keep my attention for a good while. Very fun simulator.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												This is the game to buy for your kids if they don't want to do their studies. Make them play for 5+ hours and tell them that this is their LIFE if they don't hit the books DAMN RIGHT NOW!But in all seriousness, yes, that's what you play here. A janitor. Have you ever wondered what happens after you blasted through a level in your favorite shooter and you're not in Germany, i.e. the corpses, gore, blood, guts  and other bodyparts don't simply vanish before they hit the floor? Well, this is it. The game for after the game. The alien invasion is over, our hero won and now it's time to clean up the mess.This is where you come in.Your job is to clean up the mess. To collect all those body parts and mop up the blood and gore. And as odd as it sounds, yes, that's actually fun. OCD of course helps, but even if you're not obsessed with total cleanliness, there is something ultimately satisfying to start out with a bloody mess and end up with a sparkling clean place.It is a very Zen game, though. There is nothing that would put pressure on you except your goal of cleaning it faster this time around (which usually only leads to you spilling that bloody bucket or strewing the body parts all over the place because you wanted to run with a heavy bucket), and you will spend quite a bit of time hunting down that last body part hiding behind a panel or that last speck of alien blood that you mistook for the pattern of the wall paint. Picking up bullet casings also is very ... Zen.It's also not a good idea to play this game alone in a dark room. It's quite haunting. Even though there are no living creatures but you (and your potential partners in a cleanup crew), but you are, after all, cleaning up an area where you collect bodies. Or parts thereof.Lots of fun to me, but, well, as I said: OCD might make me biased.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2016
												There's something oddly satisfying about this game.  There's no enemies to run from and/or kill, there's no time limit (unless you set one for yourself), hell there's not even any music.  The game just revolves around you as a janitor, simply cleaning up some horrible accidents.  Mopping up blood and other stuff, disposing of body parts and organs inside of an incinerator, and putting down the customary "Caution!  Wet Floor!" signs.  It may sound boring, but once you start you almost find yourself in a Zen-like trance.  You want to keep playing to make sure everything is just right before you say you've finished the job.  The only real major problem I have with the game is the pyshics.  Knocking over your bucket or biohazard bin with just the slightest touch (even happens with a single bullet shell casing) is beyond frustrating.  It's not enough to make the game unplayable, but will get even the most patient of players to drop an F bomb.  A solid 7 out of 10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Definitely a game focused around youtubers and ppl with OCD. Others may still enjoy the game, but they're unlikely to spend a lot of hours into it.I've gotten employee of the month 5 times in a row so far with my best score so far being 111% and lowest being 101% (my first one). I'm still learning though, so I'm sure I'll keep getting higher scores with each new / bigger level I complete.A few flaws worth noting:- Physics and object clipping is quite glitchy, objects will freak out if not placed just right. Levels seem to be purposely set up to test your patience and / or perception. And some thin objects like PDAs or paper notes will clip through ground, walls, pretty much everything at least a little bit.- The dev really seems to enjoy crowding the level with too many crates and barrels, making it really difficult and annoying to stack in the given small zones.- The biggest challenge this game has to offer is just maintaining patience and getting every bit of the level perfectly clean and organized. Although figuring out the causes of deaths can often be really difficult.- Logging everything like bullet casings, bullet holes, amount of dead aliens, and worst of all, the amount of objects thrown in the incinerator is probably the worst aspect of the game as it takes so long, and for whatever reason, some of it doesn't even work anyways. Just last night, I wrote in the report that I found 52 bullet holes, and when I finished the work day, back at the office, I see that it wrote down 0 bullet holes. Annoying as it affects my overall score.- I don't know if it's the game's fault or just my new router, but even after port forwarding, ppl cannot connect to my game at all. They can see me, but can't connect to me. I'm still experimenting with router settings to see if I can make it work, but looking in the Steam Discussions area, it looks to be a very common issue with this game.- This game really desperately needs a tutorial / training session. Everyone I've played with so far has had no idea what to do aside from the obvious cleaning up the bodies and blood. Completely understandably, no one knew they had to log everything and write it down in the report. No one knew they had to organize stuff, figure out the causes of deaths, count bullets and items thrown in the incinerator, etc... I myself only discovered this after retrying to finish the same level over and over and reading countless forum posts and wiki pages. Not many players would be willing to go through that much bother, as evidence by how many players got any of the achievements completed. I completed the first level, got the achievement, looked at the percentage of players who also completed it and laughed my♥♥♥♥♥off. I mean seriously, consider adding a tutorial or something, cuz that's embarrassing. Also, the "End Day" feedback is pathetic. When you get demoted for just doing the minimum, it gives no reason as to why you got demoted... "What did I do wrong?". I don't want the game to constantly hold my hand, but when you spend 4+ hours cleaning a single level, I would definitely appreciate some feedback as to what I missed and what I could have done better.But overall, I like the game cuz it's unique and interesting and fits nicely with my OCD.

												Viscera Cleanup Detail ReviewConcept: You play as a space janitor and your sole duty is to clean up the aftermath of massive FPS-style battles using numerous tools and physics objectsPros:-Multiplayer-Good Graphics-Good Optimization-Physics-Clever-Not Many Major Bugs (PC)Cons-PC Only (Mac version exists but it has been in beta for years, the code to get in is "ZeTrollPatch")-Boring as Hell Solo-Repetitive-Takes Forever-Bad Tool Placement (eg- the only incinerator being at the end of a winding hallway that's off to the side)While I have not played multiplayer yet, I can totally tell the game was meant for it. content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								There's something strangely satisfying about getting a place clean... And infuriating when you accidentally leave a trail of bloody footprints!Anyway, there's a surprising amount of content and quality in this. It's not just another simulator game made to be bad (don't get me wrong, some of those are great too).It already has a decent amount of nicely designed maps, some fun little pieces of story that might change depending how well you do your job, and it all works well and looks nice at the same time.The only negative thing I could say about it is that it sometimes seems a little unclear about what you're supposed to do about what (unless I'm just missing something). I didn't know that a laser gun would fix bullet holes, until I left the level and found a written complaint in my office, then I had to look it up.So if you've ever wanted to be a janitor without earning money for it, this is the game for you!
