content:
Posted: April 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								Although this game appears insanely silly like some of the excuses for "simulator" games we have here on Steam, the premise of this game is fantastic. I was first hooked when I randomly received a free copy of "Viscera Cleanup Detail: Shadow Warrior" for purchasing the recent Shadow Warrior title. The ragdoll physics and hilariously over-emphasized sound effects. And later on with the spin-off release of VCD: Santa's Rampage, we were introduced to co-op! That is where this game shines best. Alone, admittedly it can get a bit boring. But with others, hilarity WILL ensue. It's just a very chill game. You don't HAVE to clean up, you can just cause even more chaos with friends and still have a good time.TL:DR: BUY IT NOW

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								Probably the best way to discribe this game is to call it a parody, or even better irony in its purest form. Actually I wanted to spend this Saturday to clean up around here and now I find myself playing this clean-up-simulator next to empty bottles, a dirty plate and dust. A lot of dust. That is what I call irony.Anyway, about this game:You are a janitor which job it is to clean up a mess in a space-station caused by one of various reasons. Wheter a virus turns half the crew into zombies, the ship is invaded by aliens or some other reason you can think of, if you watched a lot of spacemarine-ish movies.Basically, it is really simple you can either do your job as you are supposed to do or you just screw around with the equippement you have. Either collect all the body parts or play basketball with them. Scrub away all the blood or splash it against the wall to make some bloody good art.There is no real goal in this game, not even a rating in the classic way. You can end your work at any given time when you activate a control panel at the station. This teleports you back in your janitor-room and some pieces of paper scattered around in that room will tell you if you did a good job or not. The biggest complaint I have about this game is pretty much that it throws you in, without telling you anything you are able to do. I mean, I know it is a game which only rule is, that it has no rules, but i would really like to know what my character is able to do. You really have to find out everything yourself from scratch, some people might like that but a bit assitance in that case would be welcome.For example, your mainweapon the scrubber tool. It turns bloody red after a few swipes over the dirty floor and in that state, instead of cleaning you just smear the blood around. Alright, you will think. The scrubber needs a cleaning itself. But how? Bashing it around with the secondary move does nothing but make the mess even bigger. Eventually you will find a waterbowl-dispenser and get the idea. Dip it in and *bling* as good as new. Now the real cleaning can begin. You carry that bowl with you, put it down, dip the scrubber in clean up, rinse and repeat.Now you will notice other things like body parts will never stop producing blood when coming in contact with anything so you need to find a way to dispose them. Or the water in your bowl starts turning red, and it won't clean your scrubber after dipping it in. Or what in the name of Odin is this device on your 3rd slot that keeps on beeping whatever you are doing?Things like these made this game a bit more frustrating than it had to be. I really like to see a creative tutorial for this game, just like in Surgeon Simulator 2013 which has shown you how to actually beat the next operation by putting a floppy-disc in the computer.All in all:It is a game to waste your time. If you have nothing better to do, you can play this. It can be really atmospheric from time to time, when you look around at the mangled corpses, blood on the wall that reads "HELP" or "DOOMED". It is still in alpha so I look forward to updates. The price was a bit too much.I give this game a total of 6 out of 10 Karmapoints, marking it as "Check it out when you have over 40 bucks on your Steam-account left anyway"

content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												Apparently I don't "get it".  This thing has huge numbers of upvotes and I just don't understand why.  Watch the video.  That really is the entire game right there.  You pick stuff up, you throw it away, you mop.  Rinse, repeat.  For hours.  I played through the entire "Waste Disposal" level just to see if I was missing something.  I got to 94% clean, and got a crap report saying I did horribly.  Reloaded a save, got the remaining 6%, and got an "employee of the month" placard.  That was it.  Absolutely did NOT enjoy the game.  I suppose if you're an ocd completionist that can find enjoyment in this kind of thing, more poer to ya.  Give this game a shot.  But I just don't see how this game has the huge ratings it has now.  It's just *boring*.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								I figured a game about cleaning up after heroes would be kind of relaxing. You know, you get to see what happened after they saved the world and play your own small part in humanity's salvation. Unfortunately, that's not what this game is. What this game is, is incredibly stressful. I admit, I didn't play it very long. I didn't give it a very fair chance. But that's because, in the first however many minutes I played, I had to replace my mop bucket ten times. Every third mop bucket I got from the mop bucket machine, three more new pieces of gore were pumped out, splashing blood all over the place I just cleaned and giving me more stuff to dump into the incinerator. ... Why? What is the point of that? Furthermore, the controls are non-intuitive and over-sensitive. Good luck getting that torso into the incinerator without splashing gore all over the place. This is less of a game and more of a chore. If I want to get stressed over cleaning up, I might as well, you know, actually clean up. I will be seeking a refund.

Early Access Review
								This game is a unique experience like nothing you have played before. The enticing graphics and the goofy physics will bring you hours of hilarity, add a fun/humor multiplier by having your buddies help outThe team work as well as the moments you burn something you shouldn't or spilling each others blood buckets really is a riot.I would not reccomend this for single player, you could have fun exploring but the sheer amount to do to finish the level does indeed turn it into work.I hope this game keeps the silly physics and comical atmosphere and expands upon it. content:
Posted: April 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								I like this genre of really impressive games that are fun for a couple hours (like Goat Simulator).  This game is tedious and not for everyone, but therein lies the hilarity.  You'll want to play the Shadow Warrior version in here, because your character actually talks!Be warned that it really, really is just a cleaning game.  You might think "I found a laser!  Maybe I'll have to defend myself against aliens!"  Nope.  "This station is infected, but apparently there's a cure somewhere?"  Yeah, that's what the guy who made the mess found.  It really is just cleaning (and making a horrible mess and screwing with physics and admiring all the REALLY detailed maps).

								Before you automatically think " oh wow a cleaning game - what fun!", keep in mind many games are fun that you wouldnt think would be. content:
Posted: August 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has been out for over a year and there are still way too many bugs.-Objects move on their own--sometimes they fly. -You'll get stuck in objects and sometimes the only way to get out is to restart the game. -The game will get so laggy that it'll crash your computer.-You can tip over something without even being near it.-Sometimes it takes countless times to pick something up. -You'll literally get stuck in nothing. -When you first start the game, you'll have to do a lot of changing in the settings. The turn speed will be way too fast/slow, the sensitivity was way too high, the mouse speed will have to change, and there'll have to be a few changes to adjust the graphics to your liking. I literally spent 15 minutes changing the settings. Fortunately for the game's creators, the game does have some pros:-The game IS fun when you ignore the bugs. You can spend a couple hours on just one map--more if you like fooling around.-Each map has its own story to tell and many fun things to interact with.-You can play with body parts. ( That sounded less creepy in my head. )And that's all the pros i can really think of. If the pros outweighed the cons, I'd recommend this game. Unfortunately, not many gamers will pay $10.00 for a game that makes you spend more time screaming in frustration at the bugs than the game. Hope this review helped.

Early Access Review
								I got the Shadow Warrior version of this for free and had no idea what it was at first. I played it and absolutely loved it. Then I immediately bought the Santas Rampage version and knocked out all of the achievements for that one and enjoyed that as well. THEN I saw this on early access and was like F%$K YEAH DUDE!!!! This is only early access but there are like 6 levels and Im guessing each could take possibly a couple hours to finish. I will try not to play them until achievements are added just to keep it fresh but from loading up the first level and checking it out I know for sure I am going to enjoy this one MORE then the other two. Do yourself a favor and just buy this game, you wont be dissapointed. 10/10TLDR: Buy this game, its good clean fun (hurr hurr hurr)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'm a huge fan of silly games. I also have a deep love for mindless, repetitive actions which are time-consuming and entertaining at the same. This is the game that happens to fit those requirements just right.During my first play I found the game rather clever and definitely amusing, but once you clean the first entire level and get that oh-so-sweet sense of 'I did it how the heck did I manage all that' you look at the other levels and frankly think 'oh god no thank you'. But then I went to bed and didn't stop thinking about it until I started dreaming about cleaning. It's addictive. Really, really, addictive. There's something magical about collecting tens of buckets of bloody water and boxes of body parts before gleefully incinerating them all as the facility creaks and groans ominously around you. My bedroom is a bombsite and cleaning makes me wince, but this game does nothing but make me smile and rage as yet another box of arms capsizes and leaves blood everywhere.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								I really enjoyed this game, not only because it's an interesting concept, but because it's genuinely entertaining, it's kind of quaint really, something most people wouldn't consider to be interesting. If there is anything bad I can say, it's that the game needs a progression system, and more tools, at the moment it's like a crappy retail store where MOP CLEANS EVERYTHING! To give you a little on the premise, it's basically that Quake 1-4 rolled through a space station, graphic'd up, and then you have to come in and clean up.Dead Space+Quake+Blue Collar Work= Viscera Cleanup Detail.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'll start this off by saying, I've had this game pre-ordered for months, long before the spin-off games were produced. I was still messing around with some of the earliest alpha phases of this game. I've been a long-time fan since then and can't wait to see how it progresses.This game is deceptively hard. At first you think it's more or less easy to clean things up, but no. No, there is always a spot you've missed or can't quite reach (due to glitches generally given the development stage). Pick up the trash. Pick up the gore. Wipe up blood. Throw stuff in the incinerator. Patch bullet holes, etc. (The bullet holes are the worst because then you have to wipe down the ♥♥♥♥ing ashes which takes forever and the laser goes all over the place if you aren't careful.) If you drop the gore bits, then they'll splash blood everywhere and if you step in blood, you'll track it for ages until you manage to get it off your shoes. Very thorough. The dispensers for water buckets and waste containers used to have a chance to spit random gore at you, but I don't know if that's removed. It was one of the most frustrating parts of cleaning and I kind of wanted to know how on earth it got IN THE MACHINE in the first place.Despite all of this and how it seems like an enormous chore, I keep playing. For some reason, it's fun and relaxing to mindlessly clean a gore-splattered space station. It was more frustrating before they added the save feature, which was nice. Now I don't have to worry about sitting down for two hours to attempt to meticulously clean one blasted room. Somehow, it's self-rewarding to slowly clean up the maps. No need for achievements or anything, just a nice clean space with a feeling of accomplishment.There are also periodically hints of what happened in the space station story-wise, but that's not terribly fleshed out, not yet anyway.It's such an odd concept to be a janitor that cleans up after who knows what, but I love it.This review isn't entirely fair as it's more of a progress monitoring at this stage. When the game is properly release-ready, then this will update to a more formal review.

Product received for free
												Viscera Cleanup Detail doesn't connect to anyone, and no servers appear, even when one is right there. I can't connect to a game directly through Steam which if pretty dumb, but the friends on my list don't even show up on the servers to join "Like they should" Reading a bit online this has been an issue for well over two years. I disabled all my firewalls and shields and anti-maleware and anti-virus systems to try and connect to a single computer anywhere in the world. Nothing. The only thing I haven't tried was one suggestion saying I should redirect ports and crap directly through Steam and screw that. If other games like Battleblock theater or Borderlands connect me to my friends with ease then this should be the same. The fact that this multiplayer game won't let me connect means there's literally no playing value for me.

								This game has been out for over a year and there are still way too many bugs.-Objects move on their own--sometimes they fly. -You'll get stuck in objects and sometimes the only way to get out is to restart the game. -The game will get so laggy that it'll crash your computer.-You can tip over something without even being near it.-Sometimes it takes countless times to pick something up. -You'll literally get stuck in nothing. -When you first start the game, you'll have to do a lot of changing in the settings. The turn speed will be way too fast/slow, the sensitivity was way too high, the mouse speed will have to change, and there'll have to be a few changes to adjust the graphics to your liking. I literally spent 15 minutes changing the settings. Fortunately for the game's creators, the game does have some pros:-The game IS fun when you ignore the bugs. You can spend a couple hours on just one map--more if you like fooling around.-Each map has its own story to tell and many fun things to interact with.-You can play with body parts. ( That sounded less creepy in my head. )And that's all the pros i can really think of. If the pros outweighed the cons, I'd recommend this game. Unfortunately, not many gamers will pay $10.00 for a game that makes you spend more time screaming in frustration at the bugs than the game. Hope this review helped.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												FIrst off, let me say I got this game on sale. So the negatives are even more appalling considering the regular price for this game. Let's just get into pros and cons.Pros:-The game is creative and unique-There's a lot of customizability, different modes and levels.Cons:- The physics are janky as hell. It took me like almost 5 minutes to turn off the music player when I couldn't hear the beeping from the tracker.- The game likes to punish you when you accidentally spill a bucket (and trust me, you will) by occasionally plopping out viscera instead of a bucket when you go to get another from the machine. You also make footprints every time you step in something, there's a gun you can equip in the first level that if you accidentally fire, makes even more of a mess with charring all over the walls.-The game doesn't have a tutorial, so I ended up knocking all over♥♥♥♥♥♥(including empty buckets) trying to pick up a bucket. When you go to clean the mop, there's a command mapped to the right mouse button that jabs with the bucket (often resulting in a dropped bucket that leaves blood all over the place) Like, how was I supposed to know once a bucket is full I'm supposed to put it in the incenerator?-Speaking of the incenerator, sometimes the viscera and dead bodies don't despawn in it and I spent a whole hour neglecting it until towards the end.-There's an elevator thingy that occasionally jams, sends you in the air, or falls over and sends you in some random direction and other such nonsense-Occasionally when I try to get a bucket out of the machine, it gets stuck in the collision and flings out spilling on the floor. To add insult, the afforementioned viscera-instead-of-bucket♥♥♥♥♥♥can happen right after.-I spent two hours playing the game and at the end I got demoted for not knowing what I was doing because the game never told me how to play the game or gave me any indication when I'd be done.- You accidentally grab other things instead of the thing you want because everything is so poorly modeled-Did I mention the game looks like Postal 2 and was released LATE 2015?! I know that graphics aren't everything, but it looks so drab and uninteresting. It wouldn't be a flaw at all if it didn't come with plagues of gameplay problems.-My mouse once got stuck on the menu and I was forced to use my keyboard and gamepad to get out. If I hadn't had a controller plugged in, I would have had to ctrl+tab to get out.- The game took a bajillion years to get installed with it's 2 gb and million loading screens before the first initial playthrough-The command prompt for the game is by default mapped next to the mop buttontl;dr While a fun idea and neat concept, it has a terrible execution with frustrating gameplay, horrible optimization and bugs and glitches galore. Don't even bother getting the game on sale. It's not even worth that.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
												I feel like there was a bit of a missed opportunity here to implement a more substantial overall progression, like getting upgrades for your mop or finding temporary supercleaning powerups or something to break up the monotony. At the same time though, I can see how that might go against the design philosophy. It really is a game built to revel in the mundanity, at which it absolutely succeeds. It's just kind of a sad reminder of the times that even "space janitor" is somehow a gripping escapism for some.There will still be occasional instances of gibs or spatters ending up out of bounds or stuck inside an impossible piece of geometry, but otherwise 8/10 would play to escape existential crises again. It's not a game for everyone though and if it sounds absolutely uninteresting to you, it probably will be.

content:

Early Access Review
								An interesting game but its novelty wears off quickly, all of about 10 minutes, perhaps more with afew friends.The physics makes large objects unwieldy and knocking over a mop bucket or being unable to get something into a disposal bin only to flip it on its side gets old really really fast.And the bullet casings, dear god the bullet casings.This game needs more tools and improvements to its physics before it can be considered a fun experience.Add a space vacum for bullet casings and small vicera that has them stick to the end until you toggle it off.Make the buckets stay upright or add something akin to a firehose/packpack that you refill to get rid of the blood spatter faster/easier but make the blood locations more creative/plentiful to compensate.Don't buy unless its on special or until it improves

content:
Posted: February 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								There is plenty of promise in this game, but the level of tedium currently outweights the pleasure.  The mechanics of the game fails in a couple of places:A) You've cleaned the level, but the punch-out console reveals the job is not done: you pull out your sniffer tool to complete the finishing touches to only find it is entirely unhelpful.  You're left with the dilema of wandering about, what appear to be pristine halls, with a tool that doesn't do the job - of letting you finish.  Fix it, or allow the sniffer to "zap" clean small areas with a long timer when a large percentage of the map is clear.B) The mopping mechanic is great, tediously picking up each shell casing and each tiny gib of viscera is not.  A dustbin and broom solves the problem and works with the best mechanic.  Or use a metal and and organic magnet tool that pulls small objects to it, by way of spraying gore and machine oil everywhere as the solid chunks get attached to it.C) Let the good times roll:  the bloody gibs should be, for purposes of mopping up more fun, dripping and oozing - encourage people to either deploy bins and store the gibs, with small drips - or be "punished" by having to mop up the gore trails to the incinerators.

content:

Early Access Review
								While this game may seem like a simple and relaxing mopping simulator, it's more than that. It's actually a training exercise created by the dominant to trick the submissives like me into doing chores. Which isn't all that bad since when I ever get in that type of relationship, I can easily be the submissive in the relationship. In other words, I'm prepared to be the slave that my boyfriend would want for me to be, weather it be in bed or in the kitchen.I'm safe to say this game taught me all I needed to know to be in the kitchen, except cooking, which I've learned from playing Cooking Mama.

Buy this game.I kept saying to myself "I'll just wash this one wall" or "I'll just clean up this one pile of body parts before I go to bed" and then BOOM, 4 hours have passed, and I'm still not done cleaning my first space station.This is frustratingly hilarious, and a game that must be in everyone's library. Buy it. Now!

								SS13, a 2D game that's nearly ten years old and free, has a much more engaging janitor simulation. The game is garbage, and likely always will be.
